definitions.definition: To settle (a place) with colonists , and hence make (a place) into a colony .
To settle (a group of people, a species, or the like) in a place as a colony.
To settle among and establish control over (the indigenous people of an area).
To begin a colony or colonies.
To intrude into and take over (the autonomy, experience, social movement, etc, of a less powerful person or group); to commandeer or appropriate .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To settle (a place) with colonists , and hence make (a place) into a colony .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To settle (a group of people, a species, or the like) in a place as a colony.
( transitive ) To settle among and establish control over (the indigenous people of an area).
( intransitive ) To begin a colony or colonies.
( transitive , social sciences , by extension ) To intrude into and take over (the autonomy, experience, social movement, etc, of a less powerful person or group); to commandeer or appropriate .
